direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the standard Object class contract and are often tested together.
Both methods involve checking the state of flags, though one checks equality and the other checks if a flag is off.
Both methods involve checking the state of flags, though one checks equality and the other checks if a flag is on.
Both methods provide a representation of the object's state, though one is for equality and the other is for string representation.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the Flags object with specific flags is necessary to set up the state for equality testing.
Modifying the flags state using turnOn is necessary to test different states for equality.
Modifying the flags state using turnOff is necessary to test different states for equality.
Checking if a flag is on can be used to verify the state after equality testing.
Checking if a flag is off can be used to verify the state after equality testing.
